name: patient_id
description: Unique patient identifier

name: diagnosis_chronic_intractable_pain
description: Patient has chronic intractable pain that may be treated with spinal cord stimulators

name: diagnosis_neuropathic_pain
description: Indication for SCS, representing neuropathic pain

name: diagnosis_nociceptive_pain_severe_intractable
description: Indication for SCS, representing nociceptive severe, intractable pain (with limited value)

name: procedure_spinal_cord_stimulator_trial
description: Percutaneous implantation of neurostimulator electrode(s) in the epidural space for assessing patient suitability for ongoing treatment with a permanent stimulator

name: procedure_spinal_cord_stimulator_permanent_implant
description: Surgically implanted nerve stimulator for ongoing treatment of chronic intractable pain

name: prerequisite_successful_scs_trial_for_permanent_implant
description: An effective and documented trial is a prerequisite for permanent nerve stimulation implantation

name: scs_replacement_without_trial_flag
description: Indicates that a new trial is not needed for SCS replacement due to battery change, malfunction, or end of stimulator life

name: prior_conservative_treatment_required
description: SCS therapy should be considered only after more conservative attempts (medications, physical therapy, psychological therapy, or other modalities) have been tried

name: multidisciplinary_team_evaluation_required
description: Patients must have undergone careful screening, evaluation, and diagnosis by a multidisciplinary team prior to implantation

name: psychological_evaluation_required
description: Required psychological evaluation as part of the multidisciplinary screening prior to implantation

name: no_active_substance_abuse_issues_required
description: Patients must not have active substance abuse issues

name: patient_education_and_disclosure_required
description: Patients must undergo proper patient education, discussion, and disclosure, including risks and benefits of SCS therapy

name: scs_trial_setting_restriction
description: Temporary neurostimulator trials are preferably placed in an ASC or outpatient hospital setting; an office setting is allowed if sterility, equipment, training, and support personnel are available

name: scs_permanent_implant_setting_restriction
description: Permanent neurostimulators must be placed in an ASC or hospital

name: physician_scs_trial_privileges_or_board_certification_required
description: Physicians performing SCS trials in an office setting must have like privileges at a local hospital or ASC, or be subspecialty boarded in Pain Medicine by the American Board of Anesthesiology

name: scs_physician_continuity_written_notification_required
description: If the trial physician does not or cannot implant the permanent neurostimulator, the patient must be informed in writing and given the referral surgeon's name

name: scs_trial_success_pain_reduction_percentage
description: Minimum 50% reduction of target pain for a successful SCS trial

name: scs_trial_success_analgesic_medication_reduction_percentage
description: Minimum 50% reduction of analgesic medications for a successful SCS trial

name: scs_trial_success_functional_improvement_required
description: Requirement for some element of functional improvement for a successful SCS trial

name: physician_low_scs_trial_to_implant_ratio_threshold
description: Physicians with a trial to permanent implant ratio less than 50% will be subject to post-payment review

name: scs_maximum_leads_reimbursed
description: Maximum of 2 leads reimbursed per anatomic spinal region per patient per lifetime

name: scs_maximum_contacts_reimbursed
description: Maximum of 16 contacts reimbursed per anatomic spinal region per patient per lifetime

name: scs_maximum_trials_per_region_lifetime
description: Maximum of 2 SCS trials reimbursed per anatomic spinal region per patient per lifetime

name: repeat_scs_trial_extenuating_circumstances_only
description: A repeat SCS trial is not appropriate after a failed trial unless there are extenuating circumstances that led to trial failure

name: diagnosis_code_ICD10
description: ICD-10-CM codes including Z45.42 (Encounter for adjustment and management of neurostimulator), M48.061, and M48.062

name: procedure_code_CPT
description: CPT codes identified as related to SCS, including 63661, 63662, 63688, 95970, 95971, and 95972 (noted as removed from this LCD)

name: procedure_code_HCPCS
description: HCPCS code L8680, identified as related to SCS (noted as deleted from Group 2 of the LCD)
